meanings.definition: A print made by the process of chromolithography.
meanings.sent1: I saw a beautiful chromolithograph of a flower at the art gallery.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of chromolithographs from the 19th century.
meanings.sent3: The chromolithograph of the cat wearing sunglasses made me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a vibrant chromolithograph.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the chromolithograph were so vivid, it felt like the flowers were real.

meanings.sent1: The artist will chromolithograph the illustration for the book cover.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to chromolithograph images during her art class.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally chromolithographed my handprint on the paper.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to chromolithograph themselves in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The machine whirred as it began to chromolithograph the design onto the canvas.
